com.vintage.finances.models

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vintage.finances.models.Transaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents a single immutable transaction between an Account and an Entity.
    Author:
    Mark LeBlanc

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Transaction.Direction
      Enumerated collection of available Transaction directions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transaction(Currency amount, Transaction.Direction direction)
      Creates a single immutable transaction between two entities.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Currency getAmount()
      The Currency being transferred.
      Transaction.Direction getDirection()
      Controls the direction of this transaction.
      long getIdentifier()
      Uses Java's built-in library SecureRandom to provide a unique identifier, seeded by the current time.
      Transaction.Direction getInverseDirection() 
      Transaction getInverseTransaction()
      Clones the original transaction, and inverses the direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(Currency amount,
           Transaction.Direction direction)
        Creates a single immutable transaction between two entities.
        Parameters:
        amount - The Currency that is being transferred.
        direction - The direction of the transaction; either incoming, or outgoing.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        public Currency getAmount()
        The Currency being transferred.
        Returns:
        The Currency being transferred between an two entities.

      • getDirection

        public Transaction.Direction getDirection()
        Controls the direction of this transaction.
        Returns:
        The direction of the transaction; either incoming, or outgoing.

      • getInverseDirection

        public Transaction.Direction getInverseDirection()
        Returns:
        The inversed direction.

      • getIdentifier

        public long getIdentifier()
        Uses Java's built-in library SecureRandom to provide a unique identifier, seeded by the current time.
        Returns:
        The unique identifier for this Transaction.

      • getInverseTransaction

        public Transaction getInverseTransaction()
        Clones the original transaction, and inverses the direction.
        Returns:
        A cloned Transaction with the direction inversed.
